guide.title: Gnome 2.18 Upgrade Guide
guide.abstract: This is a guide for upgrading from GNOME 2.16.x to GNOME 2.18.x.

section.title: Totem's browser plugin flags have changed! Now I get seamonkey!

body.p: Totem's gecko USE flags have been rearranged. Instead of defaulting to seamonkey and selecting firefox or xulrunner based on flags, it now defaults to firefox, and selects xulrunner or seamonkey based on flags. This is for 2 reasons. First, because seamonkey doesn't run on all arches, so it needed to have a USE flag that could be masked. And second, to bring totem in line with the usage of other Gnome apps, such as epiphany. Here are the possible combinations of flags, and what they mean to totem now:

pre.caption: Totem browser plugin USE flag combinations

body.pre: USE="-nsplugin" # Disable the browser plugin; no gecko will be pulled in USE="nsplugin -xulrunner -seamonkey" # Build the plugin against firefox. This is the default in all profiles. USE="nsplugin xulrunner -seamonkey" # Build the plugin against xulrunner. USE="nsplugin xulrunner seamonkey" # Build the plugin against xulrunner. (xulrunner beats seamonkey) USE="nsplugin -xulrunner seamonkey" # Build the plugin against seamonkey.

body.p: There is a known bug in Gnome 2.18.1 where tray icons for thing starting up in your session sometimes do not show up in the tray. The program is running, but it's tray icon is missing. This happens to gnome-power-manager in many cases. The work-around is to restart the program after the session is up, and the icon will be there for the rest of the session. For gnome-power-manager, follow these steps:

pre.caption: Getting the gnome-power-manager tray icon back

body.pre: In a shell, type: # killall gnome-power-manager Then, select System -> Preferences -> Power Management
body.p: This will get you your g-p-m tray icon back.

section.title: Deskbar-applet errors out on login when using tracker

body.p: There is a known bug in trackerd that causes a race at login, where trackerd is starting, and deskbar-applet tries to start it via it's dbus interface. This causes deskbar-applet to error out. To get deskbar-applet working again (with tracker), follow these steps:
body.pre: In a shell, type: # killall deskbar-applet Then, when the dialog comes up asking to restart it, select "Reload".
body.p: This must be done once on login. Deskbar-applet will then work for the rest of the session.
